revealed_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
revealed_symptoms.evolving: This thing keeps changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before.
revealed_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
revealed_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.
revealed_symptoms.nodule formation: It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles.
revealed_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
revealed_symptoms.satellite lesions: There are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.

hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
hidden_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
hidden_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, I’ve got this thing on my skin that looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. Also, it’s been changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. And there are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. There's also this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. Plus, there are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.

Thank you for providing such detailed information. Given your description, I am concerned about a potential skin cancer. I'd like to ask you a few more questions to help narrow down the possibilities. First, has anyone in your family ever had skin cancer?
No, I don’t think so. Not that I know of.
Thank you. Next, can you tell me more about your history of sun exposure? Have you spent a lot of time in the sun, and have you ever had bad sunburns, especially as a child?
I’ve spent a fair amount of time in the sun over the years, yeah. And, yeah, I've gotten sunburned pretty bad a few times when I was younger.

Thank you. Now, I'd like to ask you about the lesion itself. Has the border of the lesion been irregular, or have you noticed any changes to the edges of the spot? Also, is the spot itchy or painful at all?
No, I haven’t really noticed anything about the edges. But it’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
Thank you. One last question about the lesion: have you noticed any open sores or ulcers on the spot? Has the skin broken open at any point?
No, I haven’t noticed any open sores or anything like that.

Also, it’s been changing—getting darker, bigger, or just looking different than before. And there are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. There's also this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it. It’s kind of thick or raised, not flat like some of my other moles. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. Plus, there are these little dots or spots popping up near the main one, like it’s spreading.
